item.title: Java Applets In Dorms: The Browser Wars Begin
item.description: Java: The Future of Computing? In February 2000, just two months after the Y2K celebration, the tech world buzzed with a different promise: write once, run anywhere. Java was going to revolutionize computing. Sun Microsystems was betting big on appletsâ€”small Java programs that would run in web browsers, turning the browser into a universal application platform. As an NTU student in the dorms, I had front-row access to this revolution. Every lab machine had Java installed.
